camel.source.path.host.name: camel.source.path.host
camel.source.path.host.description: Hostname for the SMSC server to use.

camel.source.path.port.name: camel.source.path.port
camel.source.path.port.description: Port number for the SMSC server to use.

camel.source.endpoint.initialReconnectDe.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialReconnectDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialReconnectDe.description: Defines the initial delay in milliseconds after the consumer/producer tries to reconnect to the SMSC, after the connection was lost.

camel.source.endpoint.maxReconnect.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxReconnect
camel.source.endpoint.maxReconnect.description: Defines the maximum number of attempts to reconnect to the SMSC, if SMSC returns a negative bind response

camel.source.endpoint.reconnectDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.reconnectDelay
camel.source.endpoint.reconnectDelay.description: Defines the interval in milliseconds between the reconnect attempts, if the connection to the SMSC was lost and the previous was not succeed.

camel.source.endpoint.splittingPolicy.name: camel.source.endpoint.splittingPolicy
camel.source.endpoint.splittingPolicy.description: You can specify a policy for handling long messages: ALLOW - the default, long messages are split to 140 bytes per message TRUNCATE - long messages are split and only the first fragment will be sent to the SMSC. Some carriers drop subsequent fragments so this reduces load on the SMPP connection sending parts of a message that will never be delivered. REJECT - if a message would need to be split, it is rejected with an SMPP NegativeResponseException and the reason code signifying the message is too long. One of: [ALLOW] [REJECT] [TRUNCATE]

camel.source.endpoint.systemType.name: camel.source.endpoint.systemType
camel.source.endpoint.systemType.description: This parameter is used to categorize the type of ESME (External Short Message Entity) that is binding to the SMSC (max. 13 characters).

camel.source.endpoint.addressRange.name: camel.source.endpoint.addressRange
camel.source.endpoint.addressRange.description: You can specify the address range for the SmppConsumer as defined in section 5.2.7 of the SMPP 3.4 specification. The SmppConsumer will receive messages only from SMSC's which target an address (MSISDN or IP address) within this range.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.enquireLinkTimer.name: camel.source.endpoint.enquireLinkTimer
camel.source.endpoint.enquireLinkTimer.description: Defines the interval in milliseconds between the confidence checks. The confidence check is used to test the communication path between an ESME and an SMSC.

camel.source.endpoint.sessionStateListen.name: camel.source.endpoint.sessionStateListener
camel.source.endpoint.sessionStateListen.description: You can refer to a org.jsmpp.session.SessionStateListener in the Registry to receive callbacks when the session state changed.

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.transactionTimer.name: camel.source.endpoint.transactionTimer
camel.source.endpoint.transactionTimer.description: Defines the maximum period of inactivity allowed after a transaction, after which an SMPP entity may assume that the session is no longer active. This timer may be active on either communicating SMPP entity (i.e. SMSC or ESME).

camel.source.endpoint.alphabet.name: camel.source.endpoint.alphabet
camel.source.endpoint.alphabet.description: Defines encoding of data according the SMPP 3.4 specification, section 5.2.19. 0: SMSC Default Alphabet 4: 8 bit Alphabet 8: UCS2 Alphabet One of: [0] [4] [8]

camel.source.endpoint.dataCoding.name: camel.source.endpoint.dataCoding
camel.source.endpoint.dataCoding.description: Defines the data coding according the SMPP 3.4 specification, section 5.2.19. Example data encodings are: 0: SMSC Default Alphabet 3: Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) 4: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary) 8: UCS2 (ISO/IEC-10646) 13: Extended Kanji JIS(X 0212-1990)

camel.source.endpoint.encoding.name: camel.source.endpoint.encoding
camel.source.endpoint.encoding.description: Defines the encoding scheme of the short message user data. Only for SubmitSm, ReplaceSm and SubmitMulti.

camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyHost.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyHost
camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyHost.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the hostname or ip address of your HTTP proxy.

camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPassword
camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the password required for your HTTP proxy.

camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPort.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPort
camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyPort.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the port of your HTTP proxy.

camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyUsername.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyUsername
camel.source.endpoint.httpProxyUsername.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the username required for your HTTP proxy.

camel.source.endpoint.proxyHeaders.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyHeaders
camel.source.endpoint.proxyHeaders.description: These headers will be passed to the proxy server while establishing the connection.

camel.source.endpoint.password.name: camel.source.endpoint.password
camel.source.endpoint.password.description: The password for connecting to SMSC server.

camel.source.endpoint.systemId.name: camel.source.endpoint.systemId
camel.source.endpoint.systemId.description: The system id (username) for connecting to SMSC server.

camel.source.endpoint.usingSSL.name: camel.source.endpoint.usingSSL
camel.source.endpoint.usingSSL.description: Whether using SSL with the smpps protocol

camel.component.smpp.initialReconnectDel.name: camel.component.smpp.initialReconnectDelay
camel.component.smpp.initialReconnectDel.description: Defines the initial delay in milliseconds after the consumer/producer tries to reconnect to the SMSC, after the connection was lost.

camel.component.smpp.maxReconnect.name: camel.component.smpp.maxReconnect
camel.component.smpp.maxReconnect.description: Defines the maximum number of attempts to reconnect to the SMSC, if SMSC returns a negative bind response

By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.smpp.basicPropertyBindin.name: camel.component.smpp.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.smpp.basicPropertyBindin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.smpp.configuration.name: camel.component.smpp.configuration
camel.component.smpp.configuration.description: To use the shared SmppConfiguration as configuration.

camel.component.smpp.enquireLinkTimer.name: camel.component.smpp.enquireLinkTimer
camel.component.smpp.enquireLinkTimer.description: Defines the interval in milliseconds between the confidence checks. The confidence check is used to test the communication path between an ESME and an SMSC.

camel.component.smpp.sessionStateListene.name: camel.component.smpp.sessionStateListener
camel.component.smpp.sessionStateListene.description: You can refer to a org.jsmpp.session.SessionStateListener in the Registry to receive callbacks when the session state changed.

camel.component.smpp.transactionTimer.name: camel.component.smpp.transactionTimer
camel.component.smpp.transactionTimer.description: Defines the maximum period of inactivity allowed after a transaction, after which an SMPP entity may assume that the session is no longer active. This timer may be active on either communicating SMPP entity (i.e. SMSC or ESME).

camel.component.smpp.encoding.description: Defines the encoding scheme of the short message user data. Only for SubmitSm, ReplaceSm and SubmitMulti.

camel.component.smpp.httpProxyHost.name: camel.component.smpp.httpProxyHost
camel.component.smpp.httpProxyHost.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the hostname or ip address of your HTTP proxy.

camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPassword.name: camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPassword
camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPassword.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the password required for your HTTP proxy.

camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPort.name: camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPort
camel.component.smpp.httpProxyPort.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the port of your HTTP proxy.

camel.component.smpp.httpProxyUsername.name: camel.component.smpp.httpProxyUsername
camel.component.smpp.httpProxyUsername.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the username required for your HTTP proxy.

camel.component.smpp.proxyHeaders.description: These headers will be passed to the proxy server while establishing the connection.

camel.component.smpp.password.name: camel.component.smpp.password
camel.component.smpp.password.description: The password for connecting to SMSC server.

camel.component.smpp.systemId.description: The system id (username) for connecting to SMSC server.

camel.component.smpp.usingSSL.name: camel.component.smpp.usingSSL
camel.component.smpp.usingSSL.description: Whether using SSL with the smpps protocol
